Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw and label two different types of habitats, one on land and one in water, such as a forest and a pond.
The student can draw and clearly identify at least two types of plants in each habitat, like trees and grasses in a forest, and aquatic plants in a pond.
The student can draw and identify at least two types of animals in each habitat, such as squirrels and birds in a forest, and fish and clams in a pond.
The student is able to compare and contrast the different types of plants and animals living in the land habitat with those in the water habitat through their drawing.
The student effectively uses observations to show patterns in plant and animal diversity between the two habitats, accurately reflecting differences in species and adaptations.
CANNOT: Might occasionally miss minor details, such as leaving one plant unlabeled, but this does not affect overall understanding.
There may be slight inaccuracies in drawing scale or proportion between objects in habitats, but these do not impact the clarity of the relationships described.
